fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38628].
  {panel}

Currently, when default values of custom fields are mapped according to certain projects or issues types, then when those are changed, the default value does not change, and remains the original value.

An example :

# Given 2 projects in JIRA, A and B
# There is a 'Number' custom field
# For this 'Number' custom field, if an issue is created in A, the default value would be '12345'. If it is created in B, the default value would be '2468'. 
# When a user creates an issue, he/she first chooses A (within the create issue form). The 'Number' field is understandably set to 12345 by default. However, if the user was to change the project to B instead, the value would not change to 2468, but remain with 12345

It would be much more convenient if the default values can keep track of any changes performed, so that the value would be updated automatically
fields.summary: Default values of custom fields should change dynamically

fields.description:
This behaviour occur only with IE 8, everything is fine with FF. 
When i try to release a production version for a product with a release date, the dialog show the date format instead of the release date.

I've also check the "Compatibility Mode related problems on Internet Explorer" and follow each and every hints descrive there but no change.

As IE is the standard here, what could be the origin of this behaviour?
fields.summary: "Release Version" dialog display date format

fields.description:
Tested in Windows 7 and Windows 8.1
Chrome version: Version 35.0.1916.114 m

+Affected section: *People*+
- The popup disappears when trying to hover the mouse onto it
!people.png|thumbnail!

+Unaffected section: *Activity* (Comments or History)+
- The popup remains when hovering the mouse onto it
!activity.png|thumbnail!

(i) This behavior is not reproducible on latest Firefox or IE11 in Windows environment. It's also not reproducible on latest Chrome in Linux or Mac OS.

(!) It seems that jira.atlassian.com and support.atlassian.com are not affected
fields.summary: Inconsistent Hover Profile Popup on latest Chrome in Windows environment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38622].
  {panel}

h4. *Current Feature*
Projects listed in *Administration > Projects*  includes Name, Key, URL, Project Lead, Default Assignee, and Operations.

h4. *Request Description*
Projects listed in the *Administration > Projects* should also state the date and time the project was last edited derived from last activities in the projects. (i.e comments, issue assigned etc. ). This helps in determining active projects in the instance.
fields.summary: Project list should include last modified date

fields.description:
Table: cwd_directory_attribute
Column: attribute_value

How to Verify (in my environment): 
Connect to JIRA database using psql and run query:
{code}
select attribute_value from cwd_directory_attribute where attribute_name = 'application.password'
{code}

*Note how the returned value is the plain text value of the password you entered when defining the user directory in JIRA*
fields.summary: Crowd User Directory application password stored in plain text

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38608].
  {panel}

Currently, if the 'View Workflow' button is used when within an issue, the resulting view shows all of the transition labels, and for some more complex workflows, this can be rather messy to be viewed.

The default JIRA workflow is shown like this : 

!view workflow.png|thumbnail!

We can imagine that for the more complicated workflows with a lot of transitions, it can be rather messy (and somewhat confusing) to view
fields.summary: 'View Workflow' button in Issue is messy

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38607].
  {panel}

h3. Current behaviour

When we have a lot of projects, some of the projects becomes obsolete and are no longer necessary. We can't delete the project as it would delete the issues and we would loose historical data by moving the issues to another project.

h3. Expected behaviour

Create the option to convert a project into a component of another project, so all the issues will keep the historical data but without having to keep the project.
fields.summary: Ability to convert a project into a component of another project

fields.description:
If you configure the outgoing mail preferences for a user so that the user receives emails in text format, the priority field is no longer included in the emails (it is included when the format is set to HTML). To be explicit:

If you set the mail format into HTML, the *Priority* field is present
!html_format.JPG|thumbnail!

But if you choose a text format, the *Priority* field is missing.
!text_format.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Priority field is missing in Text format mails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38602].
  {panel}

Please add timeZone information of author (and may be updateAuthor) of each worklog for search endpoint, similarly to user endpoint.

E.g. http://localhost:2990/jira/rest/api/2/search?fields=*all returns:
{code}
        "worklog" : { "maxResults" : 2,
            "startAt" : 0,
            "total" : 2,
            "worklogs" : [ { "author" : { "active" : true,
                      "avatarUrls" : { "16x16" : "http://localhost:2990/jira/secure/useravatar?size=small&avatarId=10122",
                          "48x48" : "http://localhost:2990/jira/secure/useravatar?avatarId=10122"
                        },
                      "displayName" : "admin",
                      "emailAddress" : "admin@example.com",
                      "name" : "admin",
                      "self" : "http://localhost:2990/jira/rest/api/2/user?username=admin"
                    },
{code}

And http://localhost:2990/jira/rest/api/2/user?username=admin returns:
{code}
   "displayName":"admin",
   "active":true,
   "timeZone":"Europe/Dublin",
{code}

The timeZone info is missing in expanded worklog.

Thank you.
fields.summary: REST: Add timeZone to worklog.author for sarch endpoint

fields.description:
{panel:title=2021-04 - Jira 8.x update| borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
We believe at this point this problem is fixed, there were a number of changes in the recent version of Jira that improved the performance of reindexing. 

Just to name a few:
* Upgrade to the recent Lucene version 7.x 
* Optimization for the Custom Fields computation
* Increased number of Jira index threads to *20*. 
**  If you have more powerful hardware, you can [fine tune the number of Jira index threads|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/tune-number-of-jira-index-threads-826879636.html].

That being said, we don't think the CPU is bottle-neck anymore and it can be properly utilized by Jira. Examples that we have some far, show problems related to slow DB performance or slow computation of specific user's Custom Fields, those are not related to Jira directly. 
{panel}

h3. Initial Description 
We have a big JIRA instance on a really good hardware:
* ~300k issues
* 48GB RAM
* 32 cores
* SSD in RAID
* PostgreSQL on localhsot

Still, reindexing does not increase the load above 4-5 (out of 32!), database is not under high load nor the filesystem.

Clearly this means that indexing is not properly using the resources in order to index rapidly.

Even with this configuration, a foreground reindex takes about one hour which is too much for a live system, in fact is too much even for a background reindex.

{code}
top - 11:57:30 up 50 days, 21:35,  2 users,  load average: 4.43, 4.02, 3.79
Tasks: 413 total,   3 running, 410 sleeping,   0 stopped,   0 zombie
Cpu(s): 14.3%us,  0.6%sy,  0.0%ni, 84.8%id,  0.1%wa,  0.0%hi,  0.1%si,  0.0%st
Mem:  49415024k total, 48661932k used,   753092k free,   171160k buffers
Swap:  2097148k total,   139576k used,  1957572k free, 21143064k cached

  PID USER      PR  NI  VIRT  RES  SHR S %CPU %MEM    TIME+  COMMAND
18668 root      20   0 23.4g 3.0g  50m S  241  6.3  54145:22 java
13694 jira      20   0 25.2g 5.5g 496m S  110 11.6 108:55.12 java
14552 postgres  20   0 11.4g 896m 887m S   39  1.9   4:05.14 postgres
12496 postgres  20   0 11.4g 897m 890m R   24  1.9   2:07.22 postgres
14548 postgres  20   0 11.4g 947m 940m R   19  2.0   3:51.61 postgres
15014 confluen  20   0 16.9g 1.7g 8352 S   13  3.7   1196:28 java
14238 postgres  20   0 11.4g 1.0g 1.0g S    8  2.1   5:37.47 postgres
12499 postgres  20   0 11.4g 855m 850m S    8  1.8   2:06.02 postgres
30049 postgres  20   0 11.4g  78m  73m S    6  0.2   0:02.86 postgres
17921 postgres  20   0 11.4g  73m  66m S    2  0.2   0:03.98 postgres
 4955 nginx     20   0 50924  17m 2168 S    1  0.0 107:41.21 nginx
47354 postgres  20   0 11.4g 4344 2168 S    1  0.0   6:24.91 postgres                        
{code}

h4. Solution
By default, Jira uses 10 Reindexing threads. You can [tune number of jira index threads|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/tune-number-of-jira-index-threads-826879636.html].
fields.summary: JIRA reindexing is too slow - doesn't use existing CPUs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38595].
  {panel}

There are currently 2 types of RSS feeds:
- the activity stream on a project that provides all changes on issues of the project
- the filter RSS feed (issue/comments) that provides all new issues that fits the filter query

But there is no "activity stream" RSS feed based on a filter (that would provide all changes made to issues that are in the filter).
This is something that would really be usefull for people who don't like receiving many email notifications.
fields.summary: RSS Activity stream on filter
JIRA email handlers shouldn't process emails with the DELETED flag set

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38593].
  {panel}

*Title*

The title of the modal dialog says _The status 'x' cannot be removed._

This is inconsistent with the ADG, which states titles in modal dialog should not have full stops at the end, and the writing style says to use contractions. So it should be:

_The status 'x' can't be removed_

*Message content*

The message says _Statuses cannot be removed from draft workflows._

This doesn't describe the problem or tell me how to fix it. It also doesn't fit with our "friendly, yet concise" tone and certainly isn't human sounding. Perhaps something better:

_Statuses can't be removed from workflows that are in use. It's possible that an issue is using the status you're trying to delete. In order to delete this status you might need to migrate any issues to a new status._

_More information on configuring workflow (link)_

* https://developer.atlassian.com/design/1.4/foundations/language/
* https://developer.atlassian.com/design/1.4/components/modal-dialog/
fields.summary: The messaging for when I can't remove a status from the workflow editor is not helpful

!Inline Dialog.png|width=500!
fields.summary: The add status inline dialog appears at the top-left of the screen
I cannot assign an issue to an user, but I can mention him

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38588].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

* create two users; user1 and user2
* grant user1 permission to create issues in a test project and don't grant user2 that permission
* try creating an issue with a third user (let's say admin, and grant this user the *Modify Reporter* permission)
* start typing user in the reporter field: both users will be displayed)

I understand there's a field called "Creator" now in JIRA that is separated from the Reporter field, however, since the Creator field is not shown on the screen, the reporter field is considered the creator of the issue and it should show only users that are granted the *Create Issues* permission.

*note*

Additionally, the Reporter field does not respect the Customer Permission setting in a Service Desk project.
If "Who can raise requests?" is set to "Customers who are added to the project", the Reporter field will still show all the users within JIRA.
fields.summary: Users without Create Issues permission are listed is the reporter field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38587].
  {panel}

h3. Current behaviour

Currently the process to migrate from JIRA OnDemand to JIRA standalone it's a complex process which could be made easier. You have to request a backup to the OnDemand team and wait for the correct versions of the plugin for being compatible (like JIRA Agile for example when we have a new release).

h3. Expected behaviour

An option could be created in the "Restore System" section from JIRA's Administration to "Import from OnDemand", where you would place the OnDemand URL and login with your credentials to do a direct import without having to touch the data.
fields.summary: Suggestion to improve the migration between JIRA OD and standalone

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38585].
  {panel}

It is possible in Create/Edit/... screens to define a custom view of the displayed fields. 
This feature is nice but the configuration is only applicable to the current user.
All our projects share the same custom field scheme; but for some of these projects, the users do not need to display all the fields.
As we do not want to create a specific field scheme for these projects (due to maintenance overhead reasons), it would be nice if a user could export his own "Configure fields" settings. And to load a settings from another user (so it can be shared amongst people of the same project).
fields.summary: Allow export/import of user's "Configure fields" screen settings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38580].
  {panel}

I frequently interact with a colleague "Carl".
When I'm trying to add him as a watcher by typing [ Carl ], the first suggestion in the drop down menu is always for another person "Carla".

I've never interacted with Carla.
I've never chosen that name from the search results when I searched for [ Carl ].

Since I'm performing a filter/search already, I don't mind if the search results get sorted by frequency rather than alphabetically.

Suggestion:
When filtering by a search term, it would improve the user experience if all the user-suggestion lists were sorted by search result usage.

Measuring usage by "how often the searcher has chosen a search-result, either tracked by search term, or globally", and hopefully separate usage by field.

Unclear bits:
If I often Assign tasks to "Walt", that *must* influence the suggestions for an Assign field, but it's not clear if this should extend to other fields, for example, the Watchers field.
fields.summary: Sort user search results based on frequency of use {watchers, assignees, etc}

fields.description: If you filter down issues, then add columns and set everything up the way you want, then save the filter, the next time you click on that filter, all the custom columns go away. The only way to get them back is to click on the 'Columns' drop-down, click on 'Filter' or 'System', and then back to 'My Defaults'. Magically, the columns re-appear.
fields.summary: Saved Filter Custom Columns don't display properly

fields.description:
h3. Summary of Bug

Directly after a ticket is closed, but before the page is refreshed, it appears to be possible to perform an inline edit. However, attempting to do so would end up with an error (either in the UI, or in the browser side)

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# In a project with the default workflow (so as to ensure that closed issues are not able to be edited), create an issue
# Close the issue
# Without refreshing the page, hover the mouse over one of the system fields. The option to edit them would be available
# If an inline edit is attempted, one of the following would occur :
#* An error message would appear, starting - "You do not have permission to edit issues <Issue key>"
#* An error would appear in the development console of the browser when  the edit is attempted. No errors appear in the error, but both the tick and cross buttons cannot be pressed
fields.summary: Inline Editing after an issue is closed results in an error
Issue status styling (color, css) inconsistent across JIRA

I am using cloudbees (hosted Jenkins) with the jira plugin 1.38 (latest available) and my build just started failing yesterday after I pushed a change attached to a closed ticket (in my current sprint that i just checked in but it needed a tweak).  It seems that Jira is returning invalid xml now when I try to do this causing the build to fail.  I had to remove the Jira plugin to keep working.  It stopped working May 29th.  I love JIRA but unfortunately I do not know how the Jenkins plugin works, only that it appears that JIRA is returning invalid xml to it when runs a query. fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38553].
  {panel}

Currently if you sort the issue navigator by components, it only sorts based on the first component, but not the others. For example, let's say we have the following components: A, B, C, D, E.
The expected sort order of the issues with the following components in the issue navigator should be:
A
A, B
A, B, C
A, B, C, D
B, C
B, C
B, C, D
B, C, D
B, C, D, E

But in reality, JIRA sorts only by the first component and everything jumbles up: [^Sort.jpg]
fields.summary: Sorting by Component in issue navigator should take into account all components instead of only first component

fields.description:
We have an add-on which makes multiple calls to the JIRA API for creating/updating/deleting configuration objects. Those calls are made in a database transaction so that we can roll back the changes in case something goes wrong during the process. However, since caches are not transaction-aware our add-on may receive wrong data from the cache. 


Steps to reproduce:
# Start a thread - thread1. Within it start a database transaction (using the com.atlassian.jira.transaction.Txn API)
# In thread 1 create an issue type using com.atlassian.jira.config.IssueTypeManager.createIssueType(String, String, String) - this will clear the issue types cache
# Start another thread - thread2. Retrieve all issue types using com.atlassian.jira.config.ConstantsManager.getAllIssueTypeObjects() - the result will not contain the newly created issue type, because the transaction in thread1 has not been committed yet
# In thread1, call com.atlassian.jira.config.ConstantsManager.getAllIssueTypeObjects() - the result will again *not contain the newly created issue type, although the call is made within the same transaction*. That's because all values are read from the cache, which was populated by thread2!

In our case thread1 is our add-on, while thread2 is JIRA Agile, which is querying the issue types. We have also observed this with custom fields, but I guess it applies to all configuration objects which are cached.
This is also a problem in the other direction - thread2 may see data from the caches which is not actually committed to the database and may be rolled back in any moment.

This is serious concurrency issue which may affect any code which uses the JIRA API for managing configuration objects within the boundaries of a database transaction and is very hard to investigate.
fields.summary: JIRA caches are not transaction-aware

fields.description:
Putting credentials in request parameters is likely to lead to those credentials being logged in access logs.

 
h4. Workaround

The following workaround is available in Jira 8.0.0 and higher versions.

If you wish to prevent users from authenticating using url parameters, specifying their username & password in url parameters, then
 1. Stop Jira
 2. Open <Jira-installation-directory>/WEB-INF/web.xml
 3. Search for `<param-name>allowUrlParameterValue</param-name>`
 4. Modify `<param-value>true</param-value>` to <param-value>false</param-value>
 5. Start Jira.

Note prior to making this change we suggest checking your Jira log files for log events like the following
{code:java}
User "example-user" authenticated using os_password as a query parameter, this means of authentication has been deprecated. {code}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38532].
  {panel}

h5. Introduction
*How user picker works*
* It figures out the group via Project -> Role -> Group (i.e. determines that the assignable users for project X are the users in the role Y, and therefore the users in the group Z).
* Uses the configured User Directories (AD, Crowd...) to get a list of users that belong to group Z.
* Matches the entered characters with the user name, the email address and display name.

*Can you change the interval*
Unfortunately no. It will do a request 75 millisecond after entering a character. If the user enters another character in that 75ms period, it will restart the timer. In other words, if the user types the name really fast, it won't do a search until the full name has been entered. A hacky way to force that behaviour is to write the username somewhere else, copy and paste it into the field: that will result in just one REST call.

*Will it cause performance issue*
Yes, It could cause performance problems. At least, there are a two potential problems:
* If the user has multiple User Directories, searching for the members of a group could be slow. Solution: reduce the number of User Directories and/or move the User Directory that will contain the requested group at the top of the chain.
* If the project has a very broad assignable group, (eg: all the users in JIRA are potentially assignable, but only a bunch of them are actually assigned), retrieving the list of users and matching the characters could be expensive. Solution: create a smaller assignable group, it is better to add users when needed, than to add lots of JIRA users that never get an issue assigned.

h5. Suggestion
It would be great if JIRA administrators can configure User Picker, for example the REST interval.
fields.summary: Allow better configuration of User Picker custom field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38527].
  {panel}

In the user profile's activity stream it will send queries to the database to retrieve user activities. 

It's been noted, however, that getting the stream to populate can be extremely slow. Adding an index on the {{author}} column in the _changegroup_ table may speed up the query and get the activity steam populated faster. 

By default the schema for the  _changegroup_ table are:
{code:sql}
6.2.4=# \d changegroup
           Table "public.changegroup"
 Column  |           Type           | Modifiers
---------+--------------------------+-----------
 id      | numeric(18,0)            | not null
 issueid | numeric(18,0)            |
 author  | character varying(255)   |
 created | timestamp with time zone |
Indexes:
    "pk_changegroup" PRIMARY KEY, btree (id)
    "chggroup_issue" btree (issueid)
{code}

By adding an index on the {{author}} column performance of the query is anecdotally improved from 2-3 seconds to 0.02 seconds.

(!) *Note:* If customers wish to perform this operation themselves on their own database please understand that this involves customizing your standard JIRA database which falls out of our [Support Offerings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Support/Atlassian+Support+Offerings]. If the customisation is thought to be the cause of any issues in your system you will be asked to restore your database back to its default state with the anticipation that functionality will return to default from there.
fields.summary: Add author column in the changegroup table to speed up query

fields.description:
If I type something into a field, then try to navigate to a different page without processing the data, JIRA helpfully pops up a Confirm Navigation dialog that makes sure that I really did mean to trash that info.

Unfortunately it also does this for the login form (when JIRA is not using an external authentication system).  Since many browsers (eg. Chrome, Opera) will pre-fill values in the username / password fields without user interaction, this becomes particularly noticeable.

How to reproduce:
# Log into JIRA instance and save the password when prompted by the browser.
# Log out and revisit the login page.
# Close the tab without changing any of the input fields.

or more simply:
# Go to JIRA instance login page and enter some text in one of the fields
# Close the tab

Actual result: The "Confirm Navigation" dialog is shown.

Expected result: The tab should close without showing the "Confirm Navigation", since there is no valuable information to be lost.
fields.summary: "Confirm Navigation" dialog appears on login page

fields.description:
Hi,

I have set up security for a client in a way that you have Users | Developers & Administrators, where Developers can do everything Users can + some extra permissions (like creating issues etc). Administrators can do everything that developers can + some extra permissions (like administering the tool). I have done this in all the 6 tools (JIRA, Confluence, Stash, Bamboo, FeCru & Crowd) & it all works, but I have stumbled upon a bug.

I added jira-administrators to the 'JIRA Administrators'-permission & 'Create Shared Objects'-permission. As a consequence, I can't add jira-administrators to the 'JIRA Users'-permission as this is not needed for administrators.

To be able to create a dashboard however, an account has to have the 'JIRA Users'-permission. This makes it impossible to create a dashboard as an administrator with the current permission settings.

As a temporary workaround, I added the people inside jira-administrators also to jira-users. But this is not the way I like it. I would like the jira-administrators to only be placed in the group jira-administrators and be able to do everything a user & a developer can + administration tasks.

Kind regards,
Dimitri
fields.summary: Can't manage dashboard as administrator

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Setup JIRA and Confluence installations with mostly similar user base, but having some JIRA users who cannot log in to confluence.
(i) Fastest way to do this is setting up confluence to use JIRA as a user server.
(i) A natural user case is scenario where confluence license user tier is lower than JIRA.
# In confluence Global Permissions grant anonymous 'Use' permission.
# Create a confluence space with anonymous 'View' permission, and create an unrestricted page in this space
# Login to JIRA with a user that doesn't have credentials to log on to confluence #* try to find the page or space created in the previous step.
#* From a service desk with a configured Knowledge Base, type in text contained in the Confluence space or page, while trying to raise a Request.

*Expected Results*
Since this space and Confluence global permission has granted anonymous view access, and this same users can actually view the same content by accessing confluence directly without needing to log-on to confluence, the content should be available to them when logged-on to JIRA.

*Actual Results*
* None of this anonymously accessible confluence content is available in either JIRA or Service Desk to logged-in JIRA users who don't have login credentials to JIRA.
* Only JIRA users who belong to groups that are specifically added to the 'can use' permission in Confluence, can see all the content granted to anonymous users.

h3. Problem Definition
There is no method to reset a Permission Scheme to factory Defaults. 

Occasionally, the Default Permission Scheme is modified in JIRA and this is unintentional. 

Otherwise, the permission scheme is modified, but this scheme becomes inappropriate for the use-case of JIRA and the Administrator would like to start from a clean slate. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option to reset the default permission scheme to default, or create a Default Permission Scheme from scratch instead of having to copy one. 
 
h3. Workaround
Manually reconfigure an Existing Permission Scheme.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38475].
  {panel}

The current function of changing *Custom Field's* description is limited if there is a value in the Field Configuration. Therefore, global changing a Custom Field's description will be a hassle if an instance has a lot of *Field Configurations*

*Expected result:*
Changing the description in Custom Field page could be globally applied.

*Actual result:*
Unless description of a Custom Field is being cleared from the Field Configuration, the change will not be reflected.
fields.summary: Allow global change option in Custom Field description

fields.description:
If you remove a comment from an issue, the updated field from the issue is not updated in the index. to reproduce this bug:

1 - Create an issue
2 - add a comment to that issue
3 - visit /rest/api/2/search?jql=key={issueNr} and notice the updated field.
4 - remove the comment from the issue
5 - visit - /rest/api/2/search?jql=key={issueNr} again and notice that the updated field isn't changed

if you go to /rest/api/2/issue/{issueNr} you can notice that the updated field actually is properly updated after you have deleted a comment, but only not in the search index. If you update the index manually by the admin page and then go back to the link /rest/api/2/search?jql=key={issueNr} you can see that the updated field now is set properly.

Note: this is only when removing comments, if you remove a attachment the updated field from the issue is updated.
fields.summary: Updated field from issue does not reindex after deleting a comment
